title: Woodlands Redoubt
text:
Woodlands Redoubt, also known as one of the two Twydall Redoubts, was constructed in 1888. It was not included in the original list of defensive structures proposed by the <a href="Royal%20Commission%20on%20the%20Defence%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">Royal Commission on the Defence of the United Kingdom</a> in 1860, but was conceived later and implemented as an experimental redoubt as opposed to a more substantial fort.
In conjunction with <a href="Grange%20Redoubt">Grange Redoubt</a> its function was to defend <a href="Chatham%20Dockyard">Chatham Dockyard</a> against landward attack from the east.
